channel.title: CVE Feed for wpdevteam -- EmbedPress – Embed PDF, YouTube, Google Docs, Vimeo, Wistia Videos, Audios, Maps & Any Documents in Gutenberg & Elementor
channel.description: The latest CVEs for wpdevteam -- EmbedPress – Embed PDF, YouTube, Google Docs, Vimeo, Wistia Videos, Audios, Maps & Any Documents in Gutenberg & Elementor

item.title: CVE-2023-4282|2024-08-02T07:24:03.815Z -- wpdevteam -- embedpress%20%E2%80%93%20embed%20pdf%2C%20youtube%2C%20google%20docs%2C%20vimeo%2C%20wistia%20videos%2C%20audios%2C%20maps%20%26%20any%20documents%20in%20gutenberg%20%26%20elementor
item.description: The EmbedPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized loss of data due to a missing capability check on the 'admin_post_remove' and 'remove_private_data' functions in versions up to, and including, 3.8.2. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber privileges or above, to delete plugin settings.

item.title: CVE-2023-3371|2024-08-02T06:55:03.189Z -- wpdevteam -- embedpress%20%E2%80%93%20embed%20pdf%2C%20youtube%2C%20google%20docs%2C%20vimeo%2C%20wistia%20videos%2C%20audios%2C%20maps%20%26%20any%20documents%20in%20gutenberg%20%26%20elementor
item.description: The User Registration plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure due to hardcoded encryption key on the 'lock_content_form_handler' and 'display_password_form' function in versions up to, and including, 3.7.3. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to decrypt and view the password protected content.

item.title: CVE-2023-6986|2024-08-02T08:50:07.948Z -- wpdevteam -- embedpress%20%E2%80%93%20embed%20pdf%2C%20youtube%2C%20google%20docs%2C%20vimeo%2C%20wistia%20videos%2C%20audios%2C%20maps%20%26%20any%20documents%20in%20gutenberg%20%26%20elementor
item.description: The EmbedPress – Embed PDF, YouTube, Google Docs, Vimeo, Wistia Videos, Audios, Maps & Any Documents in Gutenberg & Elementor plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's embed_oembed_html shortcode in all versions up to 3.9.5 (exclusive) due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2023-4283|2024-08-02T07:24:03.691Z -- wpdevteam -- embedpress%20%E2%80%93%20embed%20pdf%2C%20youtube%2C%20google%20docs%2C%20vimeo%2C%20wistia%20videos%2C%20audios%2C%20maps%20%26%20any%20documents%20in%20gutenberg%20%26%20elementor
item.description: The EmbedPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the 'embedpress_calendar' shortcode in versions up to, and including, 3.8.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
